patient_data.medical_history: Family history of Type 2 diabetes (mother, grandmother), hypertension (father)

critical_alerts.message: Urgent evaluation for diabetes mellitus is needed due to symptoms of fatigue, frequent urination, excessive thirst, unexplained weight loss, blurred vision, and family history of Type 2 diabetes.
High blood pressure reading of 145/92 requires monitoring and further evaluation to assess for hypertension.

drug_interactions.message: No significant drug-drug interactions detected among the current medications.

missing_info.message: Missing information on blood glucose levels and HbA1c to assess for diabetes mellitus.

recommendations.message: Immediate referral to a healthcare provider for comprehensive evaluation of diabetes mellitus including blood glucose testing, HbA1c, and further workup. Monitor blood pressure closely and consider lifestyle modifications for hypertension prevention.

original_form_text:
COMPREHENSIVE MEDICAL INTAKE FORM

Patient Name: Sarah Chen
Date of Birth: March 15, 1988
Age: 37
Gender: F
Weight: 125 lbs
Height: 5'4"
Phone: (555) 234-5678
Emergency Contact: Michael Chen (Husband) - (555) 234-5679

Primary reason for today's visit:
Experiencing severe fatigue, frequent urination, excessive thirst, and unexplained weight loss over the past 3 weeks. Also having occasional blurred vision and slow-healing cuts on hands.

CURRENT MEDICATIONS:
Medication Name | Dosage | Frequency | Prescribing Doctor
Birth Control Pills | 0.15mg/0.03mg | Daily | Dr. Williams
Ibuprofen | 400mg | As needed | Over-the-counter
Multivitamin | 1 tablet | Daily | Self-administered

Drug Allergies:
Penicillin (causes severe rash and swelling)

VITAL SIGNS:
Blood Pressure: 145/92
Heart Rate: 98
Temperature: 99.2°F
Respiratory Rate: 18
Oxygen Saturation: 97%

MEDICAL HISTORY:
Chronic Conditions:
Family history of Type 2 diabetes (mother, grandmother), hypertension (father)

Previous Surgeries:
Appendectomy (2019)

SOCIAL HISTORY:
Tobacco Use: Never
Alcohol Use: Occasional social drinking (2-3 drinks per week)
Exercise: Minimal due to recent fatigue
Diet: Regular diet, has been eating more sweets lately due to cravings
Occupation: Software Engineer (sedentary work)
Stress Level: High due to work deadlines

FAMILY HISTORY:
Mother: Type 2 Diabetes, Hypertension (age 58)
Father: Hypertension, High Cholesterol (age 62)
Grandmother (maternal): Type 2 Diabetes, died from complications
Siblings: One brother, healthy

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:
Constitutional: Fatigue, weight loss (15 lbs in 3 weeks), increased appetite
Eyes: Blurred vision, especially when reading
Cardiovascular: No chest pain, occasional palpitations
Genitourinary: Frequent urination, especially at night (4-5 times)
Skin: Slow healing cuts, dry skin
Neurological: Mild dizziness when standing quickly

ADDITIONAL NOTES:
Patient reports recent high stress at work, poor sleep quality, and has noticed increased thirst requiring her to drink water constantly throughout the day. She has been concerned about the rapid weight loss despite eating more than usual.

ASSESSMENT NEEDED:
- Blood glucose testing
- HbA1c
- Comprehensive metabolic panel
- Thyroid function tests
- Urinalysis

Provider: Dr. Jennifer Martinez, MD
Date: June 22, 2025
Time: 2:30 PM
